div1.p: Lazear writes that he will continue to work next year at the hospital with the same appointment.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 12, 1898
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your note and
know you had
arrived safely at
Pittsburgh.

It has been warmer
this week than before
but we find it
cool out here in
the evenings.

I think we shall
go to Mrs. Coreys at
Brightside, about
half a mile from
here toward town.

We can get a room
there for eighteen
dollars a week.

It is on the lake
like this place.

I have not been
to Windsor since
you left.

We received an
invitation to Commencement
from Alex. which
indicates that he
has passed.

Work at the Hospital goes on
the same as ever. I learn
that my appointment is the
same next year as this.

I hope you will be out of
doors as much as possible
Give my regards to Mr
& Mrs McCallam and the
young ladies.

Mabel sends her love. She
is going to add a few lines.
